alert.note: Alert for Boulder (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 11:03PM MDT until August 20 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MDT SATURDAY FOR NORTH CENTRAL BOULDER COUNTY... At 1103 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rain continues in the warned area under a stationary but weakening storm. Between 0.3 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen over the Calwood burn scar. Additional rainfall amounts up to a 0.25 of an inch is still possible through midnight. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Boulder County, including the Calwood Burn scar. No reports of flooding have been received from local authorities at this time. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy rainfall will cause flash flooding of creeks, streams, and ditches in the Calwood burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected. The main areas of concern are Heil Valley Ranch and Lefthand Creek just above US 36.
